learning_outcomes.description: Take account of current debates in palaeoecology through understanding and reflection on the content of lectures, practicals and required readings.
Develop skills of research, analysis and argument in the areas of palaeoecology.
Describe key concepts in fire ecology, through understanding and reflection on the content of lectures, practicals and required readings.
Develop skills of research, analysis and argument in the areas of fire ecology.
Describe how key concepts in palaeoecology and fire ecology are crucial for effective natural resource management and conservation.
Describe how fire can impact Australian landscapes and key issues that need to be taken into account for planned burns.

assessments.task_description: There will be four practical exercises in this course. Students are expected to submit a completed practical workbook at the completion of each session, or through Blackboard as advised during the session in the relevant week. Students need to pass the practical component of the course to achieve a passing grade.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted at the end of each class for grading (in class) or through blackboard (online) by the end of the relevant week (4 pm Friday).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission is not possible. If the deadline cannot be met, students must apply for an extension before the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Using the information and data that will be provided in class develop a poster that outlines an appropriate fire management plan that will address key conservation and hazard minimisation goals that are relevant for a national park in SE Queensland.


The poster will be graded based on a criteria posted on Blackboard and there will be a course hurdle attached to this assessment item (students must achieve at least 45% for this assessment item to pass the course).
assessments.submission_guidelines: Completed assignments must be submitted as an electronic copy in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission is not possible. If the deadline cannot be met, students must apply for an extension before the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: Students will complete an Online Exam, made available through Blackboard, during week 13. It will cover key aspects of the course based on the lecture material. The exam will be made available for a 48 hour period during week 13 and, once started, you will have two hours in total to complete the exam.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Completed assignments must be submitted through the link accessible on Blackboard. Instructions will be posted well in advance of the date.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late submission is not possible. If the deadline cannot be met, students must apply for an extension before the due date.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
